column4: hi! My Ubuntu is terribly sloooooow compared to windows for example. Do you know what might be the cause??
you haven't installed your graphics drivers
are you running off the livecd?
no, it's from hard drive. First programs work very slow and secondly there is a time when entire system doesn't respond
open a terminal and type top and hit enter
well it says firefox takes about 60% of cpu and xmms about 15%
what windows are you comparing it to and whats your ram/cpu speed
winx XP. about 700 MB of RAM, CPU 1,8 AMD Athlon
is it net applications that are slow, or everything
was the livecd just as slow?
sometimes even terminal hangs. I haven't used livecd
you mean of the screen? it's 1024x768 75Mhz
have you run linux before? any livecds? do you have any esoteric hardware?

yup, slackware - it ran really nice... no, I don't have any... apart from Pen Drive, which isn't esoteric, I guess. Looking at top, I am under impression that kernel is dividing cpu time strangely, for example a while ago xmms consumed 95% percent of its usage!!
